Subjective: Trouble passing hard stools for 3 months; no fever, no blood in stool; abdominal pain, cramps, bloating; no appetite; underweight; no weight loss; no research on family history of low weight; tried olive oil to soften stool; no improvement; no other family members with bowel problems; sister has ulcerative colitis; no concern about ulcerative colitis; regular periods; no urination issues; no other symptoms; wants to know if serious, wants permanent solution.
Objective: Vitals: not provided; Physical Exam: normal bowel sounds; varying tympani; no pain in abdomen; sensitive in lower left quadrant; no fever, no blood in stool.
Assessment: Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS); constipation; no signs of ulcerative colitis, HNP, or cauda equina.
Plan: Prescribe psyllium fibre sachets to soften stool; take daily for 6 weeks; evaluate results in 6 weeks; follow-up if abdominal pain worsens, fever develops, or blood in stool appears; discuss dietitian next time
